body:
Like in notabug, right? I can understand that, but I can understand Reddit’s as well. For me, no biggie, in fact.

You know what, I have a feature proposal: IMO, the like/dislike (which is what the current system is) system kind of empowers users to express themselves *emotionally* about a given content. *I think discord and Mastodon (and even Facebook) do it better by allowing different reactions instead of just giving it a thumbs up or down*. 

Let’s have an anger reaction, repulsion, love, like, dislike etc... let the “rep” amount (which is needed for posting images, profile pics, creating guilds) be the simple sum of the number of reactions (rewarding people who get most engagement, for good or for bad). Let people not to react at all, of course.

Also, depending on the kind of reactions you get on the site, a non-editable (by the user) badge could be added to the user name based with the reaction a given user gets the most here, perhaps an emoji with the reaction that the user gets the most and the number of said reactions (example @theunknownguyfromnowhere 😡 2,5k) - *just like true reputation*! EDIT also, different from Facebook, only the reaction a post or comment gets the most would be displayed, to make more difficult for users the game their own reputation using bots or throwaways.

That way, people will be able to express themselves emotionally about posts and comments, there will be a consequence for being edgy, controversial or troll-y (or friendly, conciliatory etc) but at the same time people won’t be restricted from site wide features for being unpopular, or worse, brigaded out of these said features for being unpopular.

What do you think, folks? Does the idea have any merit? Is it feasible or a coding hell? Etc.

EDIT: also, the user might be able to opt-out from this reputation system: in this case, their reputation won’t appear publicly, they won’t be able to see the others’ reaction reputation, or give reactions to posts and comments, their rep number will be made private and they won’t be able to see other’s rep (they would not be able still acquire rep also). I thought about that option because some people have issues like low self esteem, depression etc and  negative validation having a bad reputation badge, even in an anonymous user account, can lead to to these issues getting worse.

EDIT 2: or perhaps it’s better keep likes and dislikes for a simple and proven user experience? Just made a thought experiment using the site with the system I suggested and now I think perhaps it’s not a so great idea. Of course, if you liked it, please state it so and why, so I perhaps I’ll change my mind again 😅...

EDIT also, different from Facebook, only the reaction a post or comment gets the most would be displayed, to make more difficult for users the game their own reputation using bots or throwaways.

That way, people will be able to express themselves emotionally about posts and comments, there will be a consequence for being edgy, controversial or troll-y (or friendly, conciliatory etc) but at the same time people won’t be restricted from site wide features for being unpopular, or worse, brigaded out of these said features for being unpopular.

EDIT: also, the user might be able to opt-out from this reputation system: in this case, their reputation won’t appear publicly, they won’t be able to see the others’ reaction reputation, or give reactions to posts and comments, their rep number will be made private and they won’t be able to see other’s rep (they would not be able still acquire rep also). parent.body:
Like in notabug, right? I can understand that, but I can understand Reddit’s as well. For me, no biggie, in fact.

You know what, I have a feature proposal: IMO, the like/dislike (which is what the current system is) system kind of empowers users to express themselves *emotionally* about a given content. *I think discord and Mastodon (and even Facebook) do it better by allowing different reactions instead of just giving it a thumbs up or down*. 

Let’s have an anger reaction, repulsion, love, like, dislike etc... let the “rep” amount (which is needed for posting images, profile pics, creating guilds) be the simple sum of the number of reactions (rewarding people who get most engagement, for good or for bad). Let people not to react at all, of course.

Also, depending on the kind of reactions you get on the site, a non-editable (by the user) badge could be added to the user name based with the reaction a given user gets the most here, perhaps an emoji with the reaction that the user gets the most and the number of said reactions (example @theunknownguyfromnowhere 😡 2,5k) - *just like true reputation*! EDIT also, different from Facebook, only the reaction a post or comment gets the most would be displayed, to make more difficult for users the game their own reputation using bots or throwaways.

That way, people will be able to express themselves emotionally about posts and comments, there will be a consequence for being edgy, controversial or troll-y (or friendly, conciliatory etc) but at the same time people won’t be restricted from site wide features for being unpopular, or worse, brigaded out of these said features for being unpopular.

What do you think, folks? Does the idea have any merit? Is it feasible or a coding hell? Etc.

EDIT: also, the user might be able to opt-out from this reputation system: in this case, their reputation won’t appear publicly, they won’t be able to see the others’ reaction reputation, or give reactions to posts and comments, their rep number will be made private and they won’t be able to see other’s rep (they would not be able still acquire rep also). I thought about that option because some people have issues like low self esteem, depression etc and  negative validation having a bad reputation badge, even in an anonymous user account, can lead to to these issues getting worse.

EDIT 2: or perhaps it’s better keep likes and dislikes for a simple and proven user experience? Just made a thought experiment using the site with the system I suggested and now I think perhaps it’s not a so great idea. Of course, if you liked it, please state it so and why, so I perhaps I’ll change my mind again 😅...

body:
Okay, I imagined some positive or negative reactions (will use the emojis I have on my iPad):

👍🏻 - for a basic reaction of like
😂 - for funny posts
👏🏻 - if you though the post is specially worthy of praise
💡 - informative, insightful posts
❤️ - if you really loved it, also good for “aww” reactions

👎🏻 - for a basic reaction of dislike
😡 - if it made you angry
🤮 - if it caused revulsion to you
🙁 - sad stories, etc
💩 - useless shitpost

If course the number could be almost infinite, but the objective is getting varied but not excessive complex. Each reaction has the same value, +1 rep.
